name: Unique Offerings
description: Due to the anomaly crisis, first contact has a renewed importance. As the Federation explores ways to improve it, they are also exploring what they can offer other societies. But they'll need help to avoid turning hospitality into hostility.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Projector Spock, Ephraim and Dot, any version of Riker, Garak, Mariner, or crew from The Animated Series, Lower Decks, or Very Short Treks will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Projector Spock, Ephraim and Dot, Riker, Garak, Mariner, or Animated crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Locarno
featured_crew.flavor: Locarno’s resentment for Starfleet grew so intense that he decided to organize his own rebel fleet.

action.name: I Could've Been The Best Pilot in Starfleet!

featured_crew.name: Garak
featured_crew.flavor: Garak doesn't mind listening to Quark's chatter, but only in the form of a simulation in the holodeck.

featured_crew.name: Mariner
featured_crew.flavor: Overindulging on Romulan ale, Mariner gets carried away with a bat’leth.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Mariner
rewards.flavor: Beckett Mariner is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. She breaks dumb rules that shouldn’t be there so she can do a better job!

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Mariner
rewards.flavor: Overindulging on Romulan ale, Mariner gets carried away with a bat’leth.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

screens.text: "The temporal anomaly crisis has prompted a review of our first contact protocol, including what we bring into other societies and factions. I understand some of you have some concerns."
"I sure do. How about we start with being a little more thorough in our briefings regarding the...customs of species we'll be making first contact with?"

"Aww, what's wrong, Will? Not a fan of microwaved leftover fish? Is your stomach too delicate after years of Betazoid cuisine? Although they could really help sweeten the pot with some nice goodies for new first contacts. Have you seen the junk they've been giving away?"
"So your concerns are no microwaved fish and more 'goodies' for first contact species? I am not sure I follow. Captain, perhaps you might provide some clarification and input of your own?"
"The temporal anomaly crisis has prompted a review of our first contact protocol, including what we bring into other societies and factions. I understand some of you have some concerns."
"I sure do. How about we start with being a little more thorough in our briefings regarding the...customs of species we'll be making first contact with?"

"Aww, what's wrong, Will? Not a fan of microwaved leftover fish? Is your stomach too delicate after years of Betazoid cuisine? Although they could really help sweeten the pot with some nice goodies for new first contacts. Have you seen the junk they've been giving away?"
"So your concerns are no microwaved fish and more 'goodies' for first contact species? I am not sure I follow. Captain, perhaps you might provide some clarification and input of your own?"
"Thank you for your contributions, Captain. There is much here to consider. I do believe you have accounted for the 'goodies' Ensign Mariner spoke of, but not the fish."

"Forget about the fish! This is all great! I mean, I was hoping you would have some ideas for some perks for those of us who excel in first or second contact. You know, maybe we can make contact with species with nice tropical vacation planets or something. I'm just saying."

responses.text: "What about you, Garak? What do you think is important?"
"As a Vulcan, what are your thoughts, Spock?"

screens.text: "Mariner, are you telling us you consider what you do 'excelling' in first or second contact? I wouldn't consider causing upheaval and risking the stability of entire societies 'excelling' in contact, would you?"

"I may not 'excel' in first contact, but I would say it's important to account for each society's unique way of life. Take us Cardassians. I'm sure you've noticed that we aren't the galaxy's most hospitable. One can't be when suspicion becomes necessary for survival."

"I am not familiar enough with Ensign Mariner's record to offer commentary. ...or were you referring to our first contact discussion? In that case, I am inclined to defer to the Council's opinions on the matter...though I do feel the ability to be flexible is vital in first contact."
"Right! Glad someone gets it! First contact requires being flexible, being able to act in the moment. And, I mean, you all can't just expect me to sit by and watch things go to hell."

"Perhaps it's a little forward for a humble Cardassian tailor to weigh in on such vital Federation matters, but since this is about making first contact, why not seek the advice of factions who have actually been through first contact with the Federation?"
